meanings.definition: Showing a strong desire to do good deeds.
meanings.sent1: She is always so deedy, helping others without expecting anything in return.
meanings.sent2: The deedy volunteer spent hours at the shelter, caring for the animals.
meanings.sent3: The deedy squirrel shared its nuts with the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her deedy nature shone brightly, lighting up the lives of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The deedy gardener tended to the flowers with love and care.

meanings.sent1: He performed a deedy by helping the elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent2: The deedy of donating food to the homeless made a big impact.
meanings.sent3: The deedy of returning the lost wallet made him feel proud.
meanings.sent4: Her deedy was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The deedy of rescuing the kitten from the tree was heartwarming.
